etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Edward Minchin (1866–1915). From scientific Latin Myxosporidia Myxosporidia + -an

definitions: A protozoan parasite of the sporozoan phylum Myxospora or class Myxosporea, chiefly affecting fishes and producing spores with extrusible coiled filaments contained in polar capsules.

notes.text: See the note on taxonomy s.v. Myxosporidia.

definitions: Of, relating to, caused by, or designating a myxosporidian.
